ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Are there currently any firearms kept in or around your home? (Please include only firearms such as handguns, shotguns, and rifles; but NOT BB guns, starter pistols, or guns that cannot fire. Include those kept at home, in a garage, outdoor storage, or on your property).
Are any of these firearms (kept in or around your home) kept loaded?
Are any of these firearms (kept in or around your home) kept unlocked?
How much have you (or someone else) taken steps to limit your child's access to the firearms in your home or on your property?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= Very much so

ElementDescription: Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Locked the firearm(s) in a safe
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Locked the firearm(s) in a cabinet or closet

Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Locked the firearm(s) in another place at home or property under lock and key
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Stored firearm and ammunition separately
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Locked the firearm(s) with a cable lock or trigger lock

Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Stored firearm(s) or ammunition with an acquaintance or relative
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Stored firearm(s) or ammunition with police

Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Stored firearm(s) elsewhere (e.g., gun shop, storage facility, shooting range)
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Gave firearm(s) to police for disposal
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Sold firearm(s) or gave them away
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Other
Which of the following best describes (to limit your child's access to the firearms in your house or on your property)? Select all that apply. Other, specify
Does your child know where the firearm(s) in your home/property are stored?
Notes: 0= No, my child does not know; 1= Yes, my child knows; 2= Do not know

ElementDescription: How much have you (or someone else) taken steps to limit your child's access to pills and/or medications in your home (e.g., locked up more toxic medications, got rid of unused or expired pills, bought only small bottles of pills)? Please include prescription and over-the-counter medications in this reply.
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= Very much so; 6= Do not know

ElementDescription: What steps were taken (to limit child's access to pills and/or medication in your home)? Select all that apply. Locked up more toxic and abuse-prone medications
What steps were taken (to limit child's access to pills and/or medication in your home)? Select all that apply. Got rid of unused or expired medications
What steps were taken (to limit child's access to pills and/or medication in your home)? Select all that apply. Kept only small quantities of medications on hand
What steps were taken (to limit child's access to pills and/or medication in your home)? Select all that apply. Used an electronic pill dispensing lock box
What steps were taken (to limit child's access to pills and/or medication in your home)? Select all that apply. Substituted aspirin or ibuprofen for acetaminophen (Tylenol)
What steps were taken (to limit child's access to pills and/or medication in your home)? Select all that apply. Other
What steps were taken (to limit child's access to pills and/or medication in your home)? Select all that apply. Other, specify
How much have you asked your child about their mood or how he/she is feeling?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: How much have you asked your child if he/she is having thoughts of suicide
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: How much have you talked with your child about how you can support him/her during a crisis?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: How much have you talked with your child about his/her safety plan?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: How much have you encouraged your child to use coping skills/strategies to deal with their feelings, struggles, or any stressful situations.\
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: How much have you participated with your child in coping strategies or activities to help them deal with feelings, struggles, or any stressful situations?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: How much have you offered emotional support to your child (such as listen to your child, tell you child he/she is important to you, give him/her a hug)?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: Since our last contact [timepoint_label], has your child reported suicidal thoughts (wishes they were dead or thoughts about ending their life) to you?
In the [timepoint_label] weeks, how often has your child reported suicidal thoughts (thought about wanting to be dead or killing self) to you?
Notes: 1= Once or twice; 2= Several day; 3= More than half the days; 4= Nearly every day

ElementDescription: To your knowledge, has your child made a suicide attempt (did something to try to end their life) since our last contact on [timepoint_label]
If yes (your child has made a suicide attempt), what was the approximate date of their attempt?
How much has you parent asked you about your mood or how you are feeling?
Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

Notes: 1= Not at all; 3= Somewhat; 5= A great deal

ElementDescription: Since our last contact on [timepoint_label] have you shared suicidal thoughts (thoughts about wanting to be dead or killing self) with your parent?
In the last [timepoint_label] weeks, how often have you shared suicidal thoughts with your parents?
